The guidelines comprise
recommendations and advice to the Latvian families planning to move to the
United Kingdom. When moving to a different country, families with children have
to comply with the effective national legislation, child care standards and
traditions in the host country, the Justice Ministry said.
 
In response to the incidents in
which foreign authorities have taken children out of Latvian families for
different violations, a working group lead by Latvian Justice Minister Dzintars Rasnacs (National Alliance) in
December 2015 agreed to step up informational and legal assistance for
protection of children of the Latvian nationals abroad, including development
of the given guidelines.
 
The first guidelines, published on
the Justice Ministry’s website, explain the key differences between Latvia and
the United Kingdom concerning children’s rights and parental rights and
obligations. 
 
The Justice Ministry is now working
on similar guidelines for emigrants to Ireland, Germany and Norway – the
countries where Latvian families most often get into trouble for breaching
